title: Change in momentum and impulse - Force vs time

content.question: A <math alttext="5 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> cart is moving horizontally with a speed of <math alttext="3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> just before it collides with a non-ideal spring attached to a second cart of unknown mass which is initially at rest. The graph shows the magnitude of the force the spring exerts on the <math alttext="5 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> cart as a function of time. What is the velocity of the <math alttext="5 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> cart just after losing contact with the spring?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="2.2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="3.8 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="4.6 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2.2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
